name: Traditional spare ribs baked
procedure: Rinse and soak the lentils in water for at least 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat and add cumin seeds. Fry for 1-2 minutes until they become fragrant.
Add diced onion and sauté until translucent, then add minced garlic and grated ginger and sauté for another 1-2 minutes.
Add chopped tomato and cook until the tomato has softened.
Drain the soaked lentils and add them to the pot, along with water, turmeric, and cayenne pepper.
Bring the mixture to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 30-45 minutes, or until the lentils are fully cooked and tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot with chopped cilantro as a garnish, if desired.

name: Spice fried rice mix chicken bali
procedure: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly browned.
Add the onion, red and green bell peppers, ginger paste, and minced garlic. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Add the cooked rice to the wok or pan and stir to combine with the chicken and vegetables.
Add soy sauce, fish sauce, and oyster sauce. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until everything is well combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped scallions or cilantro, if desired.
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Lamb chops with fruity couscous
procedure: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Season the lamb chops with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the lamb chops to the skillet and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side until browned.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes for medium-rare or until desired doneness is reached.

Meanwhile, prepare the couscous by boiling the broth in a saucepan. Remove from heat and add couscous, dried cranberries, diced apricots, honey, ground cinnamon, and salt to the pan. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Stir in the fresh parsley and mint.
Serve the lamb chops with the fruity couscous and garnish with extra fresh herbs if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Shrimp Scampi Pasta
procedure: Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
While the pasta is cooking, melt the butter with the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through.
Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
Add the white wine and lemon juice to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Let the mixture simmer for 2-3 minutes until slightly reduced.
Stir in the chopped parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the cooked pasta and shrimp to the skillet and toss to combine with the sauce.
Serve hot and garnish with grated Parmesan cheese and additional parsley if desired.
Enjoy!

name: Chicken and Vegetable Stir-Fry
procedure: Preheat your oven to 500°F (260°C).
On a lightly floured surface, stretch the pizza dough into a circle, about 12 inches (30 cm) in diameter.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the pizza dough, leaving a 1/2-inch (1 cm) border around the edge.
Arrange the sliced mozzarella cheese over the tomato sauce.
Sprinkle salt and pepper over the pizza.
Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
Top the pizza with fresh basil leaves and, if desired, a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil and crushed red pepper flakes.
Slice the pizza and serve hot.
Enjoy!
